content: Gather your ingredients. This basic Greek salad with dressing is relatively easy and makes 6 to 8 servings. You can leave out ingredients according to taste. Here's what you'll need: 2/3 cup grams feta cheese, cubed 1 head of romaine lettuce 4 tomatoes cut in wedges 1 cucumber, unpeeled, cut in rounds 1 large red onion, peeled and cut in fine wedges 1 teaspoon dried oregano 15 to 20 pitted black olives Salt to taste 2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil Prepare the base for your Greek salad. Wash the head of romaine lettuce well to rid it of any pesticides. Tear the washed lettuce into small, bite-sized pieces by hand and place the lettuce pieces into a large serving bowl. [1] If you want your lettuce to come out in more uniform pieces, use a knife to chop up your lettuce instead of tearing it. If you're not a fan of romaine, feel free to substitute your favorite lettuce, like butter lettuce or iceberg lettuce. Process the vegetables and add them to the salad. Peel the red onion and slice it thinly. Chop the cucumber into rounds and the tomatoes into wedges. Place the fresh ingredients on top of the lettuce in the serving bowl. [2] Add authentic Greek toppings. Sprinkle the salad with crumbled feta cheese. Top it off with pitted kalamata olives. Sprinkle the salad with a dash of dried oregano. [3] If you don’t have access to kalamata olives for whatever reason, black olives work just as well as a substitute. Freshly chopped oregano can be substituted for dried oregano. Dress the Greek salad with your wet ingredients. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the mixed salad. Drizzle plenty of olive oil over the bowl. [4] Season the salad by sprinkling salt and pepper onto the salad mix. Toss the salad to allow all of the ingredients to get a bit of the oil and seasoning. Taste the salad to see if it needs any additional seasoning or oil and feel free to adjust as needed. Gather your ingredients. Unlike most traditional Greek salads, this recipe doesn’t include lettuce as the base. Freshly chopped vegetables dressed with a delicious vinaigrette are the stars of this recipe. [5] Here's what you'll need: 1/2 cup olive oil 1/4 cup white wine vinegar 1 tsp rosemary leaves 1 tsp thyme leaves 1/2 tsp garlic powder 1/2 tsp oregano leaves 3 cups seeded and diced cucumbers 3 cups seeded and diced tomatoes 1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese Process the vegetables. Seed the cucumbers and tomatoes, then dice them so that they are uniformly cut into ¾-inch pieces. Slice the red onion thinly. [6] Some people enjoy having beets in their Greek salad. To alter the recipe a little, slice a roasted beet into half coins to add to your vegetable salad. Olives are another way to incorporate rich Greek flavors into your vegetable salad. Add 2/3 of a cup of pitted kalamata olives or black olives if you'd like. Make the vinaigrette. In a large bowl, mix the olive oil, white wine vinegar, and herbs with a whisk until the ingredients are blended together well. Taste the vinaigrette and add salt and pepper as need. Mix the vegetables and the vinaigrette. Add the cucumbers, onion, and tomatoes to the bowl with the vinaigrette. Use a pair of tongs to toss the ingredients well. The vegetable pieces should be evenly coated by the herb vinaigrette. [7] To allow the flavors to meld, you can over and refrigerate the vegetable salad for at least an hour before you serve. When you’re ready to eat the salad, sprinkle it with feta cheese. Gather your ingredients. The pairing is one that is unique to the Tarpon area of Florida. Greek salad with potato salad makes quite the tasty combination. [8] Here's what you'll need: For the potato salad: 2.5 lbs. red skin potatoes 2 green onions, diced 3 tablespoons mayonnaise Salt and pepper, to taste For the Greek salad: 1 head Romaine lettuce, chopped 1 bell pepper, diced 1 cucumber, diced 2 tomatoes, diced 1 cooked beet, diced 1 pepperoncini, sliced Kalamata olives to taste Olive oil to taste fresh cracked pepper, to taste Cook the potatoes. Boil a large pot of salted water. While you wait for it to boil, dice up your potatoes into one-inch cubes. Cook them for about 12-15 minutes, or until they feel tender when you poke them with a fork. [9] Be sure to salt the water liberally so that the potatoes receive some seasoning as they cook. After the potatoes have been boiled, drain the water and set the potatoes aside so that they can cool completely before proceeding to the next steps. Mix the potatoes with the remaining potato salad ingredients. When the potatoes are completely cooled down, mix them with the mayonnaise and green onions. Taste the mixture and add salt and pepper according to your preference. [10] When the potato salad is mixed and seasoned to perfection, place it in the refrigerator to allow it to cool for at least another hour. This potato salad makes about 6 servings and will act as the topping or side to the Greek salad described in the next step. Assemble your Greek salad. Place the chopped romaine in a large serving bowl. Top the lettuce with green onions, kalamata olives, pepperoncini, beets, tomatoes, cucumber, and bell peppers. [11] Serve the potato salad on the bottom of the Greek salad, on the top, or on the side. Sprinkle the salad with feta cheese and fresh cracked pepper. Top it all with a drizzle of olive oil.

<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">

<p>Greek salad is one of the most famous salads out there. Its classic ingredients are fresh tomato, cucumbers, capers, onion, <a href="/Make-Feta-Cheese" title="Make Feta Cheese">feta cheese</a>, olives, green bell pepper, and at least two or three spoonfuls of olive oil. Some people also like to add a drizzle of wine vinegar. Add a side of bread or barley rusk to make your traditional Greek salad complete.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Making_a_Traditional_Greek_Salad_with_Oil_Dressing_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_a_Traditional_Greek_Salad_with_Oil_Dressing">Making a Traditional Greek Salad with Oil Dressing</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_9962100848" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9962100848')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Gather your ingredients.</b> This basic Greek salad with dressing is relatively easy and makes 6 to 8 servings. You can leave out ingredients according to taste. Here's what you'll need:

<ul>
<li>2/3 cup grams feta cheese, cubed</li>
<li>1 head of romaine lettuce</li>
<li>4 tomatoes cut in wedges</li>
<li>1 cucumber, unpeeled, cut in rounds</li>
<li>1 large red onion, peeled and cut in fine wedges</li>
<li>1 teaspoon dried oregano</li>
<li>15 to 20 pitted black olives</li>
<li>Salt to taste</li>
<li>2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_9eb22269ef" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9eb22269ef')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Prepare the base for your Greek salad.</b> Wash the head of romaine lettuce well to rid it of any pesticides. Tear the washed lettuce into small, bite-sized pieces by hand and place the lettuce pieces into a large serving bowl.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you want your lettuce to come out in more uniform pieces, use a knife to chop up your lettuce instead of tearing it.</li>
<li>If you're not a fan of romaine, feel free to substitute your favorite lettuce, like butter lettuce or iceberg lettuce.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_6df9f13ad7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6df9f13ad7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Process the vegetables and add them to the salad.</b> Peel the red onion and slice it thinly. Chop the cucumber into rounds and the tomatoes into wedges. Place the fresh ingredients on top of the lettuce in the serving bowl.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_9c73be300d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9c73be300d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add authentic Greek toppings.</b> Sprinkle the salad with crumbled feta cheese. Top it off with pitted kalamata olives. Sprinkle the salad with a dash of dried oregano. <sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t have access to kalamata olives for whatever reason, black olives work just as well as a substitute.</li>
<li>Freshly chopped oregano can be substituted for dried oregano.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_e37c430cd8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e37c430cd8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Dress the Greek salad with your wet ingredients.</b> Squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the mixed salad. Drizzle plenty of olive oil over the bowl.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Season the salad by sprinkling salt and pepper onto the salad mix. Toss the salad to allow all of the ingredients to get a bit of the oil and seasoning.</li>
<li>Taste the salad to see if it needs any additional seasoning or oil and feel free to adjust as needed.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>

</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Making_a_Greek_Vegetable_Salad_with_Herb_Vinaigrette_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_a_Greek_Vegetable_Salad_with_Herb_Vinaigrette">Making a Greek Vegetable Salad with Herb Vinaigrette</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-6.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-6.jpg" height="546" id="img_f149887d2b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f149887d2b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-6.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Gather your ingredients.</b> Unlike most traditional Greek salads, this recipe doesn’t include lettuce as the base. Freshly chopped vegetables dressed with a delicious vinaigrette are the stars of this recipe.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup> Here's what you'll need:

<ul>
<li>1/2 cup olive oil</li>
<li>1/4 cup white wine vinegar</li>
<li>1 tsp rosemary leaves</li>
<li>1 tsp thyme leaves</li>
<li>1/2 tsp garlic powder</li>
<li>1/2 tsp oregano leaves</li>
<li>3 cups seeded and diced cucumbers</li>
<li>3 cups seeded and diced tomatoes</li>
<li>1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion</li>
<li>1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-7.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-7.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-7.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-7.jpg" height="546" id="img_2716804ad7" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2716804ad7')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-7.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-7.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Process the vegetables.</b> Seed the cucumbers and tomatoes, then dice them so that they are uniformly cut into ¾-inch pieces. Slice the red onion thinly.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Some people enjoy having beets in their Greek salad. To alter the recipe a little, slice a roasted beet into half coins to add to your vegetable salad.</li>
<li>Olives are another way to incorporate rich Greek flavors into your vegetable salad. Add 2/3 of a cup of pitted kalamata olives or black olives if you'd like.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-8.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-8.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-8.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-8.jpg" height="546" id="img_276e4ca7f8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_276e4ca7f8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-8.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-8.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make the vinaigrette.</b> In a large bowl, mix the olive oil, white wine vinegar, and herbs with a whisk until the ingredients are blended together well. Taste the vinaigrette and add salt and pepper as need.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-9.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_3073fceb9b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3073fceb9b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-9.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mix the vegetables and the vinaigrette.</b> Add the cucumbers, onion, and tomatoes to the bowl with the vinaigrette. Use a pair of tongs to toss the ingredients well. The vegetable pieces should be evenly coated by the herb vinaigrette.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>To allow the flavors to meld, you can over and refrigerate the vegetable salad for at least an hour before you serve.</li>
<li>When you’re ready to eat the salad, sprinkle it with feta cheese.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Making_a_Tarpon-Style_Greek_Salad_with_Potato_Salad_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_a_Tarpon-Style_Greek_Salad_with_Potato_Salad">Making a Tarpon-Style Greek Salad with Potato Salad</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-10.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_75c6bc4eee" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_75c6bc4eee')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-10.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Gather your ingredients.</b> The pairing is one that is unique to the Tarpon area of Florida. Greek salad with potato salad makes quite the tasty combination.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup> Here's what you'll need:

<ul>
<li>For the potato salad:
<ul>
<li>2.5 lbs. red skin potatoes</li>
<li>2 green onions, diced</li>
<li>3 tablespoons mayonnaise</li>
<li>Salt and pepper, to taste</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>For the Greek salad:
<ul>
<li>1 head Romaine lettuce, chopped</li>
<li>1 bell pepper, diced</li>
<li>1 cucumber, diced</li>
<li>2 tomatoes, diced</li>
<li>1 cooked beet, diced</li>
<li>1 pepperoncini, sliced</li>
<li>Kalamata olives to taste</li>
<li>Olive oil to taste</li>
<li>fresh cracked pepper, to taste</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-11.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_230829ed02" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_230829ed02')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-11.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Cook the potatoes.</b> Boil a large pot of salted water. While you wait for it to boil, dice up your potatoes into one-inch cubes. Cook them for about 12-15 minutes, or until they feel tender when you poke them with a fork.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Be sure to salt the water liberally so that the potatoes receive some seasoning as they cook.</li>
<li>After the potatoes have been boiled, drain the water and set the potatoes aside so that they can cool completely before proceeding to the next steps.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-12.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_ef2e302918" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ef2e302918')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-12.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Mix the potatoes with the remaining potato salad ingredients.</b> When the potatoes are completely cooled down, mix them with the mayonnaise and green onions. Taste the mixture and add salt and pepper according to your preference.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>When the potato salad is mixed and seasoned to perfection, place it in the refrigerator to allow it to cool for at least another hour.</li>
<li>This potato salad makes about 6 servings and will act as the topping or side to the Greek salad described in the next step.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=31567" href="#/Image:Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-13.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_c5cc9cbe59" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c5cc9cbe59')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Make a Traditional Greek Salad Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-13.jpg/aid31567-v4-728px-Make-a-Traditional-Greek-Salad-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Assemble your Greek salad.</b> Place the chopped romaine in a large serving bowl. Top the lettuce with green onions, kalamata olives, pepperoncini, beets, tomatoes, cucumber, and bell peppers.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Serve the potato salad on the bottom of the Greek salad, on the top, or on the side.</li>
<li>Sprinkle the salad with feta cheese and fresh cracked pepper.</li>
<li>Top it all with a drizzle of olive oil.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>

<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Feta cheese is quite salty, so you may not need to add any salt at all. Taste your salad continuously to get a better idea of what to do about seasoning.</li>
<li>If you accidentally add too much olive oil, don't fret. Too much olive oil can be soaked up with some loaf bread.</li>
<li>It is important to toss the salad well. If the salad is not tossed enough, the olive oil tends to gather and the bottom, resulting in an unevenly-flavored salad.</li>
<li>Try to prepare your salads with the freshest ingredients to ensure a great taste every time.</li>
<li>Keep ingredients cold until ready for use.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>Be careful when you grate and chop some of the ingredients. Accidents can happen in the kitchen, so make sure you are following food safety procedures, particularly while using knives.</li>
<li>Exercise good food hygiene by washing your hands before and after you handle food.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>

    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Making a Traditional Greek Salad with Oil Dressing",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Gather your ingredients. This basic Greek salad with dressing is relatively easy and makes 6 to 8 servings. You can leave out ingredients according to taste. Here's what you'll need:\n\n2\/3 cup grams feta cheese, cubed\n1 head of romaine lettuce\n4 tomatoes cut in wedges\n1 cucumber, unpeeled, cut in rounds\n1 large red onion, peeled and cut in fine wedges\n1 teaspoon dried oregano\n15 to 20 pitted black olives\nSalt to taste\n2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Prepare the base for your Greek salad. Wash the head of romaine lettuce well to rid it of any pesticides. Tear the washed lettuce into small, bite-sized pieces by hand and place the lettuce pieces into a large serving bowl.[1]\nIf you want your lettuce to come out in more uniform pieces, use a knife to chop up your lettuce instead of tearing it.\nIf you're not a fan of romaine, feel free to substitute your favorite lettuce, like butter lettuce or iceberg lettuce."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Process the vegetables and add them to the salad. Peel the red onion and slice it thinly. Chop the cucumber into rounds and the tomatoes into wedges. Place the fresh ingredients on top of the lettuce in the serving bowl.[2]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Add authentic Greek toppings. Sprinkle the salad with crumbled feta cheese. Top it off with pitted kalamata olives. Sprinkle the salad with a dash of dried oregano. [3]\nIf you don\u2019t have access to kalamata olives for whatever reason, black olives work just as well as a substitute.\nFreshly chopped oregano can be substituted for dried oregano."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Dress the Greek salad with your wet ingredients. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the mixed salad. Drizzle plenty of olive oil over the bowl.[4]\nSeason the salad by sprinkling salt and pepper onto the salad mix. Toss the salad to allow all of the ingredients to get a bit of the oil and seasoning.\nTaste the salad to see if it needs any additional seasoning or oil and feel free to adjust as needed."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Making a Greek Vegetable Salad with Herb Vinaigrette",
            "position": 2,

title: How to Make a Traditional Greek Salad
content_html:
Gather your ingredients. This basic Greek salad with dressing is relatively easy and makes 6 to 8 servings. You can leave out ingredients according to taste. Here's what you'll need:
  • 2/3 cup grams feta cheese, cubed
  • 1 head of romaine lettuce
  • 4 tomatoes cut in wedges
  • 1 cucumber, unpeeled, cut in rounds
  • 1 large red onion, peeled and cut in fine wedges
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 15 to 20 pitted black olives
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil
Prepare the base for your Greek salad. Wash the head of romaine lettuce well to rid it of any pesticides. Tear the washed lettuce into small, bite-sized pieces by hand and place the lettuce pieces into a large serving bowl.[1]
  • If you want your lettuce to come out in more uniform pieces, use a knife to chop up your lettuce instead of tearing it.
  • If you're not a fan of romaine, feel free to substitute your favorite lettuce, like butter lettuce or iceberg lettuce.
Process the vegetables and add them to the salad. Peel the red onion and slice it thinly. Chop the cucumber into rounds and the tomatoes into wedges. Place the fresh ingredients on top of the lettuce in the serving bowl.[2]
Add authentic Greek toppings. Sprinkle the salad with crumbled feta cheese. Top it off with pitted kalamata olives. Sprinkle the salad with a dash of dried oregano. [3]
  • If you don’t have access to kalamata olives for whatever reason, black olives work just as well as a substitute.
  • Freshly chopped oregano can be substituted for dried oregano.
Dress the Greek salad with your wet ingredients. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the mixed salad. Drizzle plenty of olive oil over the bowl.[4]
  • Season the salad by sprinkling salt and pepper onto the salad mix. Toss the salad to allow all of the ingredients to get a bit of the oil and seasoning.
  • Taste the salad to see if it needs any additional seasoning or oil and feel free to adjust as needed.
Gather your ingredients. Unlike most traditional Greek salads, this recipe doesn’t include lettuce as the base. Freshly chopped vegetables dressed with a delicious vinaigrette are the stars of this recipe.[5] Here's what you'll need:
  • 1/2 cup olive oil
  • 1/4 cup white wine vinegar
  • 1 tsp rosemary leaves
  • 1 tsp thyme leaves
  • 1/2 tsp garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp oregano leaves
  • 3 cups seeded and diced cucumbers
  • 3 cups seeded and diced tomatoes
  • 1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion
  • 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
Process the vegetables. Seed the cucumbers and tomatoes, then dice them so that they are uniformly cut into ¾-inch pieces. Slice the red onion thinly.[6]
  • Some people enjoy having beets in their Greek salad. To alter the recipe a little, slice a roasted beet into half coins to add to your vegetable salad.
  • Olives are another way to incorporate rich Greek flavors into your vegetable salad. Add 2/3 of a cup of pitted kalamata olives or black olives if you'd like.
Make the vinaigrette. In a large bowl, mix the olive oil, white wine vinegar, and herbs with a whisk until the ingredients are blended together well. Taste the vinaigrette and add salt and pepper as need.
Mix the vegetables and the vinaigrette. Add the cucumbers, onion, and tomatoes to the bowl with the vinaigrette. Use a pair of tongs to toss the ingredients well. The vegetable pieces should be evenly coated by the herb vinaigrette.[7]
  • To allow the flavors to meld, you can over and refrigerate the vegetable salad for at least an hour before you serve.
  • When you’re ready to eat the salad, sprinkle it with feta cheese.
Gather your ingredients. The pairing is one that is unique to the Tarpon area of Florida. Greek salad with potato salad makes quite the tasty combination.[8] Here's what you'll need:
  • For the potato salad:
    • 2.5 lbs. red skin potatoes
    • 2 green onions, diced
    • 3 tablespoons mayonnaise
    • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • For the Greek salad:
    • 1 head Romaine lettuce, chopped
    • 1 bell pepper, diced
    • 1 cucumber, diced
    • 2 tomatoes, diced
    • 1 cooked beet, diced
    • 1 pepperoncini, sliced
    • Kalamata olives to taste
    • Olive oil to taste
    • fresh cracked pepper, to taste
Cook the potatoes. Boil a large pot of salted water. While you wait for it to boil, dice up your potatoes into one-inch cubes. Cook them for about 12-15 minutes, or until they feel tender when you poke them with a fork.[9]
  • Be sure to salt the water liberally so that the potatoes receive some seasoning as they cook.
  • After the potatoes have been boiled, drain the water and set the potatoes aside so that they can cool completely before proceeding to the next steps.
Mix the potatoes with the remaining potato salad ingredients. When the potatoes are completely cooled down, mix them with the mayonnaise and green onions. Taste the mixture and add salt and pepper according to your preference.[10]
  • When the potato salad is mixed and seasoned to perfection, place it in the refrigerator to allow it to cool for at least another hour.
  • This potato salad makes about 6 servings and will act as the topping or side to the Greek salad described in the next step.
Assemble your Greek salad. Place the chopped romaine in a large serving bowl. Top the lettuce with green onions, kalamata olives, pepperoncini, beets, tomatoes, cucumber, and bell peppers.[11]
  • Serve the potato salad on the bottom of the Greek salad, on the top, or on the side.
  • Sprinkle the salad with feta cheese and fresh cracked pepper.
  • Top it all with a drizzle of olive oil.
